name: 1899 Stover Drug Store
description: Iconic Stover Drug, next door to the 251/253 Linden

name: 1901 Plattner Implement Company
description: Manufacturers and jobbers of agricultural machinery and supplies. Standing in the doorway is George Plattner.

name: 1904 Birds Eye View
description: A birds-eye view of the Old Town area.

name: 1904 Linden Street — No Cars
description: A view of Old Town — notice the lack of cars. Present-day Old Town Square in foreground.

name: 1910 Linden Street, looking north
description: A view of Linden Street looking north into what is now Old Town Square.

name: 1914 Semi-Centennial Parade
description: 251/253 Linden is on the far right. Note the Art Lab / Cozollas building was two stories at the time.

name: 1914 Bicycle Repair Shop
description: A parade floats in front of the building (far left), which was a bicycle repair shop at the time.

name: 1920 Frank Stover
description: Frank Stover in front of the Stover Drug Store

name: 1927 Parade
description: A parade in front of the building, then a bicycle store

name: 1937 Intersection of Linden and Mountain
description: A view of the intersection of Linden and Mountain streets

name: 1956 Linden Street, looking south
description: A view of Linden Street looking south.

name: 1964 Looking north.
description: A view of Linden Street looking north, during the Centennial Celebration.

name: Robertson/Hayens Block
description: Collage prepared for Grant submission. Shows Richard Cienfuegos (top left) at 18 working for Johny Ayers

name: 1995 Construction
description: Linden Street construction in front of the building before restoration began.

name: 1996 For Sale
description: The building was for sale in 1996. Restoration began a couple of years later.

name: 1996 Linden Street, 200 block
description: A view of Linden Street in the 200 block, looking north.

name: Architectural Detail
description: A view of Linden Street in the 200 block, looking north.
